page.title: 14Northwich Fire Station
page.content: The government provides a fire station in Leftwich. The firemen work 3 days on a run from 8am to 6pm. 56 hours in 3 days. They have no firewomen. 13 of the 19 men work full-time, 6 part-time. They get 2-3 calls a day, 21 a week, 800 a year. The causes of most fires are accidental and negligence. They use electronic equipment to fight fires. They wear full-fire suits and chemical protective clothing. They have 2 main engines, 1 landrover, 1 canteen van and 1 station van. The firemen retire at 55, the average age is 27. The men must be fit, dedicated to the job, brave and able to drive a fire engine. They train for 5 years. They cover an area of 68 square miles.
